edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.digitalSignature
Interface DigitalSignature

All Known Subinterfaces:
DSABasedSignature, RSABasedSignature
All Known Implementing Classes:
BcRSAPss, CryptoPPRSAPss, OpenSSLDSA, OpenSSLRSAPss, RSAPssAbs, ScDSA
public interface DigitalSignature

General interface for digital signatures. Each class of this family must implement this interface.

A digital signature is a mathematical scheme for demonstrating the authenticity of a digital message or document. A valid digital signature gives a recipient reason to believe that the message was created by a known sender, and that it was not altered in transit.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

In this case the signature object can be used only for verification.

isKeySet

boolean isKeySet()
Checks if this digital signature object has been given a key already.

Returns:
true if the object has been given a key; false otherwise.

getPublicKey

java.security.PublicKey getPublicKey()
Returns the PublicKey of this signature scheme.

This function should not be use to check if the key has been set. To check if the key has been set use isKeySet function.

Returns:
the PublicKey
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.

getAlgorithmName

sign

Signature sign(byte[] msg,
               int offset,
               int length)
               throws java.security.KeyException
Signs the given message

Parameters:
msg - the byte array to sign.
offset - the place in the msg to take the bytes from.
length - the length of the msg.
Returns:
the signatures from the msg signing.
Throws:
java.security.KeyException - if PrivateKey is not set.
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given offset and length are wrong for the given message.

verify

boolean verify(Signature signature,
               byte[] msg,
               int offset,
               int length)
Verifies the given signature.

Parameters:
signature - to verify
msg - the byte array to verify the signature with
offset - the place in the msg to take the bytes from
length - the length of the msg
Returns:
true if the signature is valid. false, otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given Signature does not match this signature scheme.
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given offset and length are wrong for the given message.
